column1: EVTDESC2575;As a result of recent action
column2: some of our territories with multiple cores have been secede to another nation.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC2580;As a result of recent action
column2: we have gained territories with multiple cores from another nation.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC2585;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has had the audacity to declare themselves independent from our rule. We should restore order
column2: and teach them a lesson while we're at it.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTB2585;Our nation's resources are better focused elsewhere. Let's forget the whole ordeal.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC2590;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has had the audacity to declare themselves independent from our rule and they declared war against us in an attempt to force us into submission. This will not stand.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column2: once

column1: EVTDESC4020;Immigrants coming to our nation have begun to develop isolated communities among themselves
column2: further slowing any process of assimilation and integration for them. Many of them feel that it is because of the harsh assimilation policies that was have instituted that they choose to do this. Regardless
column3: the law is the law and they must make an attempt to integrate
column4: or we will force them to.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA4020;Their actions are justified. We should change the laws to be more lenient.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTB4020;Immigrants? You mean they come here and expect special treatment? Haha!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC4021;The tram driver said to the migrant. To which the migrant replied with disobedience and immediately sat in the front most seat. Needless to say a fight broke out between the migrant and the tram driver. The police finally put an end to the ordeal
column2: but this incident has sparked tensions with some of the minorities living under our rule. Many of them feel that they deserve special protections against persecution. We could implement new reforms
column3: or choose to ignore the ordeal and hope it all blows over.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA4021;This is ridiculous. Reform society. Our minorities should be better protected.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTB4021;Hm. It's such a lovely day outside. I think I'll go for a walk.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTC4021;I've had enough of this. Repeal any reforms. We need to teach these minorities a lesson.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC4022;A protest has gathered in $CAPITAL$ demanding more rights to migrant workers in our country. They claim that their contribution to society has been absolutely fundamental and that we would not last a day without them. If this is true then their views certainly are warranted
column2: however this is most likely the ridiculous and flamboyant speeches of some uneducated liberal migrant. Many of our citizens feel that they are taking their demands too far
column3: and that minorities already have enough protection.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column2: I concur with them. We shall implement further reforms.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTB4022;What else can they complain about? They already achieved equality. I cannot think of any further reforms we could implement for them!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTC4022;The absurdity of these demands cannot go unpunished. Repeal the last reforms we made. Perhaps this will show them that they live in $COUNTRY$ now!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC4023;Our people have become uneasy with the rights that we have allowed immigrants. Many of them feel that it gives immigrants an unfair advantage over the native born population. If we were to repeal reform to make competition between individual more level
column2: perhaps this could appease them.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA4023;I agree. Our minorities do have too many protections.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTB4023;But what about all of the nice restaurants? Surely they should be thankful!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTDESC4030;Many in the international community view us with enmity when they see that our society still is feudal-like. While it is true that serfdom is becoming a relic of the past
column2: it has dutifully served the monarchy well for all these years. Should we really reform something that already works? Of course we must also consider that in this growing age of industry
column3: changes within society and the work structure of labour could reduce serfdom to a hindrance. Perhaps we should modernize? The potential benefits could outweigh the costs.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA4030;Freedom! Freedom for all the serfs!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTDESC4031;'"Work you git!" yells the master to his servant
column2: kicking and screaming at him as he lay crying on the ground.'\nOur system of peonage has proved effective in dealing with individual debt default by forcing the servitude of the debtor to the loaner. The servants
column3: of course
column4: disapprove of the system. While our system of debt reprisal is not uncommon
column5: there many perhaps be better alternatives with the development of new economic models
column6: or perhaps we should simply end injustices and institute prisons for bad debtors instead.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA4031;Indeed. We should end this injustice.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTB4031;I don't see any problem with our current system.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTC4031;Hearing all this makes me itch to turn back to the old ways.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC4032;Many of our prisons are beginning to complain about the number of inmates imprisoned for debt default. They say that it is becoming a real burden on our prison system and that it is beginning to turn into a boiling point
column2: as we won't have any more room for new inmates. We could turn back to the old ways and let individuals deal with bad debtors
column3: which would free many of our prisons to hold true criminals instead of over flowing with debtors. On the other hand however
column4: we could institute a method of bankruptcy
column5: like so many other developed countries are beginning to do. This could prove to be a huge burden on the state budget though should be issue loans that are not paid back.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA4032;Bankruptcy is it? Sounds interesting. We should try it.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column2: I suppose they will have to make room somehow for new inmates then.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
let's go back to the old ways.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC4033;Unpaid debt to the state is beginning to add up and covering the burden of others could prove very expensive on our behalf
column2: as many private financial institutions are looking to us to bail them out. We should consider changing the laws back to what they were and let everything sort itself out. This however could come with consequences.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA4033;Re-institute debtor's prisons. The failure of private institutions is not our problem.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTB4033;We must bail out our financial institutions
column2: lest financial collapse ensue.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC4040;They cry as they rally in $CAPITAL$
column2: demanding a fairer justice system. For awhile now
column3: we have had the luxury of being able to sentence anyone that the state believed to be a criminal without a trial of any sort. Understandably
column4: unrest among the public has begun to reach critical mass and we may have to adapt. We should consider instituting some form of basic justice system to appease the people.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA4040;They are right. Let's create a court system!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTB4040;But how will we arrest revolutionaries then?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column2: people have been realizing the inefficiency of our current justice system. While it saves time to try groups of criminals with similar charges in a single session
column3: inevitably we may mix up the innocent with the guilty since presently we do not examine each individual's case. We should consider a new justice system that leaves room for individual examination while maintaining state control over the verdict of the hearing.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTB4041;But think of the time we save!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTDESC4042;Lately the people have been demanding more control over our justice system. They state that a jury would make trials more fair
column2: because the citizens would partly determine the verdict of a hearing. Perhaps this is justified
column3: but it would also significantly increase the legal burden of proof
column4: since each case would need legal explanation to each juror.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA4042;If all to save one innocent man
EVTOPTB4042;I kind of like having state involvement only.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column2: we have been letting our people humble your position of crown for quite some time. You should reconsider all of this judicial nonsense and restore your old right

column1: EVTOPTA4043;Quite right! I am the king dammit!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTB4043;Nay. A just ruler is a wise ruler.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTDESC4050;Much of our working class is thankful that we have restricted child labour
column2: however they further desire that it be banned altogether. They are merely concerned for their child getting injured in a work-related incident
column3: as well as the immoralities of children doing gruelling labour.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA4050;I concur. We should care about the children.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTB4050;But child comprise a significant percentage of our labour market!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC4060;Many of our intelligentsia feel that it would spur invention if they were to be guaranteed of some sort of protection from intellectual property copy and fraud. We should consider creating a patent office that could facilitate that very guarantee
column2: with state enforcement.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA4060;Do they now? By all means
column2: let us spur scientific progress!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTB4060;We haven't the resources to implement a patent office.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTDESC4061;Our patent system has been limited to only the upper class inventors with professional scientific background
column2: which has indeed proved beneficial to them to hold patents on their inventions
column3: however the lower class is beginning to request that we expand the patent system to allow anyone to file a patent. This could spur inventions from all walks of life
column4: but doubtless this change would mean the need to increase our bureaucracy as well. It should be something to consider.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA4061;A society of inventors. I like it.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTB4061;What inventions could uneducated factory workers have to offer us? Nothing!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTDESC4070;'The prisoner says as the executioner drags him up the gallows. The crowd roars with anticipation
column2: only to be silenced minutes later by the weeping family of the dead man.'\nIt would seem there are some sects of society that are beginning to question the morality of turning first to the death penalty as punishment for the majority of crimes. Perhaps they are right. After all there have been a number of cases where the convicted was proven innocent after they had already been executed.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTB4070;Do we really have the means to implement a better system?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTDESC4071;While the current system of handling criminals has proved effective
column2: there are circles within the government that believe criminals could serve a higher purpose. If we were to transport our criminals to some of our remote colonies
column3: we would benefit from an increased presence there
column4: as well as a reduced administrative burden on the state. We would not need to worry about criminal affairs in the colonies either
column5: because they will be looking for the very means essential to survival instead. What do you say?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA4071;I think it's a great idea!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTB4071;Nay. Our existing system is fine.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTDESC4072;Prison administrators are complaining about the overcrowding of our state prisons. They say that there are many people there who appear to be perfectly suitable for work
column2: however their sentence does not allow them to leave on parole. If we were to implement some form of rehabilitation for the criminals of our nation
column3: we could perhaps transform them into more productive individuals
column4: or at the very least
column5: determine who is fit to release back into society. This could be an enormous administrative burden on the state however.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column2: hm? Well
column3: that's a second chance if there ever was one. Let's do it!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTB4072;We couldn't possibly fund such an endeavour.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTDESC4080;Our society is lacking artists and musicians to add a unique face to our nation. If we were to provide funds and give them a little push
column2: we may incentivize cultural activities and works of art.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA4080;By all means. We could use a more vibrant atmosphere.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTB4080;The question is: do we have the money?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC4081;A man in $CAPITAL$ has gotten quite a bit of attention with his works of art that have been displayed in the local museum. Unfortunately he has taken up other work as being an artist was not financially profitable for him. It seems as if we have indeed lost a rare jewel of an artistic mind to the rigours of everyday life. Perhaps we should allocate more funds to promoting artistic development so such an instance does not happen again?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column2: let's pay our artists more. They deserve it after all.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
but we can afford no such changes.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
I don't quite like his art style

column1: EVTDESC4082;A great artist has emerged in $CAPITAL$ and has grown to prominence in just a short while. Already his art is featured on display at our National House of Art. Our funding of cultural developments appears to be having an impact. If we were to increase funding even further
column2: perhaps we may achieve even more results.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTB4082;I see no need in increasing funding. We are successful enough.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column2: hm? A waste of money I say.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
there is a sense of a resurging Renaissance in culture and national identity. It appears a golden age of culture has dawned upon us
column3: thanks no less to the brilliant minds behind our works of art.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA4083;A cultural golden age you say? We can increase that by two fold!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC4084;A significant portion of the national budget has been going to promoting artistic development for quite some time now. Some within the government feel that this spending is unnecessary and excessive. We could lower the amount of funds for artistic development
column2: which would have an impact surely
column3: but it would be minimal at best.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA4084;Aye. Our resources are better spent elsewhere.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTDESC11104;Revolutionaries have gathered in Frankfurt and convened a makeshift parliament demanding political and social reforms
column2: along with the unification of all the German states into a single
column3: Greater German Empire
column4: or Großdeutschland Kaiserreich. As such
column5: they have drafted a constitution and named us the would-be Kaiser of this hypothetical hereditary empire. Worryingly though
column6: it is unclear whether the constitution would allow non-German states into this new empire. Should we accept this new constitution
column7: we run the risk of legally losing control over some of our held foreign territory
column8: however the benefits may outweigh the risks. We must also consider that other Great Powers
column10: may not be so keen to accept the idea of a unified German empire.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA11104;Kaiser? Of all Germany? I shan't delay!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column2: I am not willing to permit the break up of my country.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC11105;Revolutionaries have gathered in Frankfurt and convened a makeshift parliament demanding political and social reforms
column2: along with the unification of all the German states into a single
column3: German Empire
column4: or Kleindeutschland Kaiserreich. As such
column5: they have drafted a constitution and named us the would-be Kaiser of this hypothetical hereditary empire. Worryingly though
column6: it is unclear whether the constitution would allow non-German states into this new empire. Should we accept this new constitution
column7: we run the risk of aggravating the other Great Powers
column9: which turn into a dispute war over the sovereignty of all Germany.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC11106;The bloody revolutionaries from a makeshift parliament in Frankfurt have bestowed the title Kaiser of Germany upon the monarch of $FROMCOUNTRY$. The legality of this action is extremely controversial and any dispute over the succession of Germany would be valid given our status within it. We can reasonably estimate that we should be able to rely on the foreign Great Powers to come to our aid since the creation of this new "German empire" has disrupted the balance of power within Europe.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTA11106;There will be hell to pay!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTB11106;What's this? You don't think the Kaiser of $FROMCOUNTRY$ is a fit candidate?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column2: but it is not worth fighting over. We will go our own way.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC11107;An attempt at unifying all of Germany through the actions of undelegated professors
column2: journalists
column3: and other persons at a makeshift parliament in Frankfurt has failed. Their drafted constitution was rejected by both Austria and Prussia
column4: leaving many revolutionaries in Germany with crushed spirits. Perhaps one day Germany shall rise as a unified country
column5: but that time is not now.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column2: it will happen. One day...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC11150;It has come to our attention recently that $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have been unified into one nation. This could significantly change the balance of power within Europe and prove much to our disadvantage
column2: or advantage
column3: depending on how we decide to play our hand at the situation. We could
column4: on one hand
column5: form a coalition against this new state and reverse this whole unification nonsense. On the other hand
column6: we could develop closer ties to this new nation and possibly even make them our ally. How shall you proceed

column1: EVTOPTA11150;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has thrown the balance of power in Europe out the window. We cannot allow them this luxury.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTB11150;$FROMCOUNTRY$ hm? They sound like they might make a powerful ally for us!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC13270;The trade disputes between $FROMCOUNTRY$ and the Great Powers had been on-going since the latter half of the 18th century. Tensions finally escalated to the boiling point in $MONTH$ of $YEAR$
column2: when $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ officials had repeatedly turned down $COUNTRY_ADJ$ requests for unlimited trade access
column3: including a lifting of the ban on the sale of opium. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government
column4: already deeply invested in a policy of confrontation
column5: found itself with no options but to declare war
column7: the $COUNTRY_ADJ$-$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Opium War begun.\n(Note: If Hong Kong is not occupied by a European power
column9: it will be your's at its end);Les différends commerciaux entre $FROMCOUNTRY$ et les Grandes Puissances ont été permanentes depuis la seconde moitié du 18ème siècle. Les tensions ont finalement atteint le point d'ébullition au mois de $MONTH$ de $YEAR$
column10: lorsque les fonctionnaires $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ ont à maintes reprises rejeté les demandes $COUNTRY_ADJ$ pour un accès illimité commercial
column11: y compris la levée de l'interdiction de la vente de l'opium. Le gouvernement $COUNTRY_ADJ$
column12: déjà très investi dans une politique de confrontation
column16: la $COUNTRY_ADJ$-$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ guerre de l'opium a commencé. ;Die Handelsdispute zwischen $FROMCOUNTRY$ und den Großmächten bestehen nun schon seit der zweiten Hälfte des 18. Jahrhunderts. Die Spannungen eskalierten schließlich zum Siedepunkt im $MONTH$ des Jahres $YEAR$
column17: als $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Beamte wiederholt die $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Anfragen nach uneingeschränktem Handelszugang abgewiesen hatten
column18: einschließlich eine Aufhebung des Verbots von Opiumverkäufen. Die $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Regierung
column19: die schon viel in eine Politik der Konfrontation investiert hatte
column22: und so begann der $COUNTRY_ADJ$-$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Opiumkrieg.;;Las disputas comerciales entre $FROMCOUNTRY$ y las grandes potencias habían sido una constante desde la segunda mitad del siglo XVIII. Las tensiones acabaron llegando a su punto álgido en $MONTH$ de $YEAR$
column23: cuando funcionarios DE $FROMCOUNTRY$ rechazaron de forma reiterada la solicitud $COUNTRY_ADJ$ de acceso comercial ilimitado
column24: incluyendo el levantamiento de la prohibición de la venta de opio. El gobierno DE $COUNTRY$
column25: inmerso ya en una intensa política de confrontación
column26: se encontró sin más opciones que declarar la guerra
column27: dando comienzo así a la Guerra del Opio $COUNTRY_ADJ$-$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ .;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC16452;Now that the dispute of slavery is finally settled and it is illegal to own people of color
column2: there is a proponent group of society that advocates sending people of African descent back to Africa so as to keep America racially contiguous. It seems that this is legal as well
column3: since the United States constitution states that people of color are considered only 2/3 of a person in the voting process. Indeed
column4: the word "free" may apply
column5: but the term "person" apparently does not to people of non-European descent. $MONARCHTITLE$
column6: shall you support this sect of society
column7: or shall we better integrate our minorities?;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTB19007;It's best not to mettle in such affairs.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC20110;A rogue terrorist group in the state of $STATE$ has assassinated a duke of our's! This grievous crime should not go unpunished. We must teach the population a less and have them never forget that they are living under our rule now.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTB20110;I don't like where this is going. Maybe they should have greater autonomy.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column2: or Scarlet Fever
column3: is an infectious disease caused by the bacterium Streptococcus pyogenes
column4: which most commonly affects children. Before the availability of antibiotics
column5: scarlet fever was a major cause of death. It also sometimes caused late complications
column6: such as glomerulonephritis and endocarditis leading to heart valve disease
column7: all of which were protracted and often fatal afflictions at the time. A comfortable town in one of your states in the year $YEAR$ appears to have come down with a pandemic of the bacteria.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA21050;We should work to eradicate this disease by implementing more sanitary living conditions.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTDESC21060;Measles is an infection of the respiratory system
column2: immune system and skin caused by a virus
column3: specifically a paramyxovirus of the genus Morbillivirus. The virus is highly infectious and 90% of people without immunity sharing living space with an infected person will catch it.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column2: we will have eradicated measles
column3: but that day is not today..;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA31509;We shall seize Prussia's industrial heartland!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTA31511;All things must come to an end eventually...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTA31512;Austria has awoken. We have taken power!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC31525;There are a considerable number of $CULTURE$ people living in the Danube Federation. Should we petition the Danubian government to unite with them so we may once again unify all the $CULTURE$ people?;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC31530;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has sent us a delegate stating that they wish to unify with the Danube Federation to unite the rest of their people. Shall we add them as another state into our federation?;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column2: the entire basis for the Danubian Federation has begun to crumble. The other ethnic groups are questioning the dominance that the German majority will exert without the Hungarians to counter-balance them
column3: and increasingly there are demands for the federation to be undone. Many Germans are fine with this
column4: preferring to return to the Austria that was to stop what many consider the "Slavization" of Austria. Regardless
column5: there is little we can do about the situation now.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC31550;With the Danubian government having become a totalitarian regime
column2: resentment among the various ethnic groups has reached a boiling point. They are demanding their independence
column3: something which would see an end to the federation as it currently exists. The German majority is fine with this
column4: though some are also suggesting the temerity of these rebels is beyond the pale and the federation should be maintained-- by force

column1: EVTDESC31560;There has been general discontent among the Hungarians
column2: and a group of young revolutionaries have appeared to demand a number of concessions including freedom of the press. Giving them even that will not satisfy them completely
column3: but it might give the government time to put down this rebellion before it begins.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC31565;A group of Czech radical democrats attempted to overthrow the government in a coup. They were unsuccessful
column2: but their actions have inspired their countrymen to rise up in demand of freedom.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC31570;One of the most prominent members of Austrian aristocracy has been murdered by a Serbian assassin
column2: a member of a group of nationalists who seek to rejoin with the Serbian nation. There are definite suspicions that the Serbian government has been secretly helping these nationalists and is behind the event.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTNAME32509;The Alaska Purchase?;L'achat de l'Alaska ?;Der Alaska-Kauf?;;¿La adquisición de Alaska?;;;;;;;;;x;;
EVTDESC32509;The feelers put out by Eduard Andreevich Stoeckl
column2: chargé d'affaires at our embassy in $FROMCOUNTRY_CAPITAL$
column3: have had results
column4: as $FROMCOUNTRY$ has today offered to enter into negotiations over a proposed sale of our territories in North America. The $FROMCOUNTRY_CULTURE$ are offering us a price of 2.3 cents per acre for the Alaskan territories
column5: and that price seems relatively fair. The colonies could become hard to defend in the event of war with the United Kingdom
column6: so getting rid of them for a price now might not be such a bad idea. What say you
column7: $MONARCHTITLE$?;Les sondages réalisés par Eduard Andreevich Stoeckl
column8: chargé d'affaires à notre ambassade de $FROMCOUNTRY_CAPITAL$
column9: ont porté leurs fruits puisque les $FROMCOUNTRY$
column11: accepté de mener des négociations portant sur la vente de nos territoires en Amérique du Nord. Les $FROMCOUNTRY_CULTURE$ nous offrent 2
column12: 3 cents l'acre pour les territoires de l'Alaska
column13: ce qui semble relativement raisonnable. Les colonies seraient bien difficiles à défendre en cas de guerre avec le Royaume-Uni et les vendre maintenant ne serait pas une mauvaise idée. Qu'en dites-vous
column16: bezüglich des Interesses der $FROMCOUNTRY$ am Kauf unseres Gebiets in Nordamerika vorgefühlt hatte
column17: begannen heute die offiziellen Verhandlungen. Die $FROMCOUNTRY_CULTURE$ bieten uns einen Quadratmeterpreis von 0
column18: 0004 Cent für das Gebiet von Alaska an
column19: und dieser Preis scheint relativ fair zu sein. Im Falle eines Krieges mit Großbritannien könnte die Verteidigung der Kolonien schwierig werden
column20: deshalb ist es wohl keine schlechte Idee
column21: sie jetzt noch gewinnbringend zu verkaufen. Was sagen Sie dazu
column22: $MONARCHTITLE$?;;Los tanteos realizados por Eduard Andreevich Stoeckl
column23: encargado de negocios en nuestra embajada en $FROMCOUNTRY_CAPITAL$
column25: ya que los $FROMCOUNTRY$ han ofrecido hoy iniciar negociaciones sobre la propuesta de venta de nuestros territorios en el norte de América. Los $FROMCOUNTRY_CULTURE$ nos ofrecen un precio de 2
column26: 3 centavos por acre por los territorios de Alaska

column1: EVTDESC33006;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has come to us with an interesting proposal. They would have us trade ownership one of our colonies to them
column2: and in return
column3: they would secede Heligoland to us. This would certainly give our navy a more level edge against other Great Powers
column4: however we may be seceding control of valuable resources that would give our economy an edge.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC33007;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to our trade proposal! They have given us a colony in Africa
column2: and in return we have given them Heligoland. Let us hope that the trade came in our favour.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC33008;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused our trade proposal
column2: therefore no lands have been seceded
column3: and we gain none.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC33010;Our acquisition of the Netherlands has brought upon us a rather curious situation. The Dutch are so similar to us that our languages are even somewhat mutually intelligible. This makes the process of integrating the Netherlands into a part of $COUNTRY$ much easier. As such
column2: we are now accepting Dutch as an accepted culture and they are now part of our national heritage.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC33011;Our acquisition of Switzerland has brought upon us a rather curious situation. The Swiss are so similar to us that they even speak our language. This makes the process of integrating Switzerland into a part of $COUNTRY$ much easier. As such
column2: we are now accepting Swiss as an accepted culture and they are now part of our national heritage.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTA33100;We will be great again one day!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTOPTA33101;We will be great again one day!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTDESC34610;The County of Hohenzollern-Sigmaringen was created in 1576
column2: upon the partition of the County of Hohenzollern
column3: a fief of the Holy Roman Empire. When the last count of Hohenzollern
column4: Charles I (1512–1579) died
column5: the territory was to be divided up between his three sons. The Princes of Hohenzollern-Sigmaringen ruled over a small principality in southwest Germany
column6: with a seat at Sigmaringen Castle. The principality became an independent state in 1815 after the Napoleonic Wars. Its ruler was deposed however in the revolutions of 1848 and his son
column9: and then turned to Prussia for aid. Prussian troops arrived in August 1849
column10: and in a treaty signed in December Hohenzollern-Sigmaringen was annexed by Prussia

column1: EVTDESC34612;At the turn of the 18th to 19th century
column2: the King of Prussia was defeated by Napoleon I and was forced to give up Neuchâtel in order to keep Hanover. Napoleon's fieldmarshal
column3: Berthier
column4: became Prince of Neuchâtel
column6: but never actually setting foot in his domain. After the fall of Napoleon
column7: Frederick William III of Prussia reasserted his rights by proposing that Neuchâtel be linked with the other Swiss cantons (the better to exert influence over all of them). On September 12
column9: Neuchâtel became the capital of the 21st canton
column10: but also remained a Prussian principality. It took a bloodless revolution in the decades following for Neuchâtel to shake off its princely past and declare itself
column13: a republic within the Swiss Confederation.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTOPTB34614;It's best to leave the issue be.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTDESC36200;Danish King Frederick VII has died and left no heir. According to the recently-drafted constitution
column2: the crowns of both Denmark and Schleswig would pass to Duke Christian of Glücksburg
column3: making Schleswig a territory of Denmark. The crown of Holstein is more problematic
column4: however. The Germanic House of Augustenburg claims the crowns of both Schleswig and Holstein and is calling on all of Germany for support. If the new constitution is signed
column6: and this could provoke a war with the German nations. If the constitution is not signed
column7: it will surely be interpreted as a sign of weakness among the Danish people and the world.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC36707;Belgium has been reduced and $COUNTRY$ is all that is left. Because of this
column2: it is no longer appropriate that we identify ourselves as Belgium
column3: but rather as the County of $COUNTRY$.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC36709;With the Netherlands as the final signatory of the Treaty of London
column2: we now have the guaranteed independence of all the Great Powers of Europe. Further more
column3: some territorial changes were in order to reduce the likelihood of any possible conflict with our northern neighbour; a change we were more than happy to accept.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC37226;Our acquisition of Wallonia has brought upon us a rather curious situation. The Walloons are so similar to us that our languages are even somewhat mutually intelligible. This makes the process of integrating Wallonia into a part of $COUNTRY$ much easier. As such
column2: we are now accepting Wallonian as an accepted culture and they are now part of our national heritage.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC49100;With the invention of new technology
column2: the time is now ripe to settle the whole of Africa. Because of this

EVTDESC50005;An old soldier who fought for us in the Great War has written a book describing the injustices our people have experienced at the hands of the victors and how we as a people can recover our rights and lift our nation once more into greatness. The book has gained prominence rather quickly and the author is beginning to gain a following. The doctrine of National Socialism has been written.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

EVTDESC90110;It appears we have mistook a demonstration for a revolt and wrongly assumed the Danish king to have abdicated! Unfortunately we've already established a provisional government and the Danes believe that we are rebelling!;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;
EVTDESC90115;Schleswig-Holstein have mistook a demonstration for a revolt and believe the Danish king to have abdicated. As a result
column2: German nationalists have declared a provisional government. Rather than peacefully return control to us
column3: they intend to pursue a future with the German Confederation to the south. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ militants are angrily calling for the military to step in
column4: though some fear this may lead to war with the Germans.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC90120;Schleswig-Holstein have mistook a demonstration for a revolt and believe the Danish king to have abdicated. As a result
column2: German nationalists have declared a provisional government. Rather than peacefully return control to Denmark
column3: they intend to pursue a future with the German Confederation. If we intervene we will gain the favor of Schleswig-Holstein
column4: but we run the risk of elevating the confrontation.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC90150;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ crown wishes to annex the Duchy of Schleswig
column2: which has long been considered indivisible from the Duchy of Holstein. Our German aristocracy is enraged by this move. They believe their future lies with the German Confederation to the south
column3: but the Duke of Augustenberg has a stronger claim to Schleswig than the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ King. We must forge our own path
column4: even if it means war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC90155;The old Danish king died without an heir
column2: and Denmark was forced to draft a new constitution since that meant the end of their monarchy. Facing pressure and fearing reprisal from the German powers to the south
column3: the newly elected Danish king has decided not to sign the recently-drafted constitution.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC90160;The duchies of Schleswig and Holstein have long been united and considered indivisible under the Danish crown
column2: but a question of royal claim to the duchies combined with the Holsteinian desire to join in the larger German Confederation to the south has led to considerable difficulty for King Frederick VII. The treatment of Danish people in Schleswig living under Holsteinian domination has led to a call for the duchy to be incorporated into Danish proper. This is unlikely to be looked on favorably by the conservative German aristocracy in Holstein. With the recently-drafted November constitution
column3: the new Danish king has laid claims on Schleswig. Schleswig-Holstein is now fighting a war for independence and call on us to support them in their time of need.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC90170;We have won and the Danish have signed the Tready of Vienna
column2: henceforth we are no longer bound to them! Now we will unify with the German confederation.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;

column1: EVTDESC90190;Now that the Danish have been defeated
column2: signed the Treaty of Vienna and paid £200
column3: 000 in war reparations
column4: the spoils of war must be split. The Gastein Convention was held at Bad Gastein
column6:
1865 and stipulated the governing of Schleswig and Holstein between Prussia and Austria. The terms of the convention were as follows: 
Abandoning the condominium state of Schleswig and Holstein
Prussian control of Schleswig
Austrian control of Holstein
The purchase of Lauenburg for £300

column1: EVTDESC60162;Today crowds gathered in $CAPITAL$ to celebrate $COUNTRY$'s independence. In the modern world
column2: independence can be a fleeting thing
column3: so we must enjoy it while we can. Today
column4: $COUNTRY_ADJ$ flags wave from every window and corner
column5: and jubilant citizens sing the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ anthem. It is a heartfelt theme that speaks of better tomorrows.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC443034;Conscripts are being drafted left and right and the poor are being trained and prepared to fight. Military camps are full of fresh recruits
column2: troops are carrying out exercises in our borders and every aspect of society and every signal the government gives seems to indicate a war is in progress
column3: yet there's no war. This large disruption in the country's daily life is angering our population and making our neighbors increasingly wary.;;;;;;;;;;;x
